meanings.definition: The soil or earthy material in which fungi grow.
meanings.sent1: The gleba was rich and dark, perfect for the mushrooms to thrive.
meanings.sent2: Farmers study the gleba to understand the best conditions for growing fungi.
meanings.sent3: The gleba seemed to whisper secrets to the curious gardener.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a fertile gleba where ideas sprouted and flourished.
meanings.sent5: The gleba smelled of damp earth and promise, a hidden world beneath our feet.

meanings.definition: A mass of spores in certain fungi.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the gleba revealed a hidden world of tiny spores.
meanings.sent2: The gleba of the mushroom contained countless spores waiting to be released.
meanings.sent3: The gleba spores danced like tiny fairies in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts scattered like gleba spores, spreading far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The gleba spores clung to the air, ready to find new places to grow.

meanings.definition: The spore-bearing part of a fungus.
meanings.sent1: The gleba of the mushroom held the key to its reproduction.
meanings.sent2: In the forest, the gleba of fungi played a vital role in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The gleba looked like a tiny forest of spore towers.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like gleba, spreading and taking root in the minds of others.
meanings.sent5: The gleba of the fungus was a treasure trove of life waiting to burst forth.
